attributes.action: ensure that people found guilty of serious assault serve a prison sentence.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Stephen Gordon, 44, of Croydon was found guilty of attacking a 96 year old war veteran, Shah Chaudury, on a busy tram. Mr Chaudury lost the sight in one eye and his independence: he now lives in a care home as a result of the impact on his health of this vicious unprovoked attack. Mr Gordon on the other hand only received a 3 year supervision order requiring him to receive psychiatric help. This is not justice, does not protect the public and is a very poor deterrent.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
